Posts.Content: My sense of smell went crazy whilst on EC, everything was super strong and I couldn't bear the smell of fabric conditioner, polish disinfectant etc.  It's ok now I have moved on to paclitaxel. But I drove everyone crazy going on about how strong everything smelled. I could have got a job as a drug dog.
Posts.Title: Weird sense of smell ?

Posts.Content: I had a similar procedure on 20 January where a lump and a sentinel node was removed in my right breast.  I am also experiencing tingly sensations and soned soreness, and assumed it was normal.  I am going to follow up clinic tomorrow and will ask about it
Posts.Title: Pain after op

Posts.Content: Hi papasmurf.  I am in exactly the same position you are in and was told at my checkup after surgery that chemo was a possibility and that the Oncotype test that is done in America will come back as either a no, a maybe, or a yes for chemo.  This helps to ensure that you get the treatment that is the best for you.  My surgeon feels that mine will be a maybe.  I'm not keen on the idea but am assuming it wouldn't be offered if it wasn't my best option to keep cancer free.  I have an appointment for next week to find out what's next.  Hope all goes well for you. Jessica
Posts.Title: Possible chemotherapy

Posts.Content: Can anyone please recommend an unperfumed body lotion suitable to use during chemo? Thanks Jess
Posts.Title: Body lotion
